oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Raymond B. Witt's remarks at an informal school board meeting, 1965 April 15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Transcription of Raymond B. Witt's remarks at an informal 1965 meeting of the Chattanooga, Tennessee Board of Education. Witt outlines the legal details of their case against James Mapp and states that they need to decide whether to submit to court rulings or appeal the judge's decisions.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Mapp v. Board of Education of Chattanooga; Segregation in education -- Law and legislation; Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education meeting agendas, reports, and correspondence, 1965-1966
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1965-1969
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
